type.short-description: Distance to start of area with reduced adhesion factor
Distance to speed restriction due to Axle load
Distance between two location reports from the train
type.description: The train has to report its location every D_CYCLOC meters.

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: The train has not to report cyclically its location.

type.short-description: Distance from the End of Authority to danger point
Distance to emergency stop location
type.description: Distance between the LRBG and the emergency stop location

type.short-description: Distance from End section timer start location to End of Authority
Incremental distance to next change of gradient.
Distance from location where to connect/disconnect to a radio in-fill unit
Distance to level transition

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: Now (The level transition is performed upon receipt of the order)

type.short-description: Incremental linking distance to next linked balise group
Incremental distance between locations where the train has to report its position.
Distance between EOLM and start of loop
type.description: The EOLM specifies the distance to the beginning of the loop transmission

type.short-description: Distance between the last relevant balise group and the estimated front end of the train (the side of the active cab).
Incremental distance to the next change of mode within the MA
Maximum distance for overriding the train trip
type.description: This variable is part of the National Values

type.short-description: Maximum distance for reversing in Post Trip mode
type.description: This variable is part of the National Values

type.short-description: Roll away distance limit
type.description: This variable is part of the National Values and is used for Roll Away Protection and Reverse Movement Protection

type.short-description: Maximum distance for running in Staff Responsible mode
type.description: This variable is part of the National Values

type.short-description: The distance from the End of Authority to the end of overlap
Route kilometre offset from the referencing balise
type.description: The geographical position reporting function uses this variables content as an offset from the referencing balise to the reference point.

type.short-description: Distance to RBC transition
Reference distance
type.description: Distance between the LRBG and the new shifted location reference. The positive values are in the nominal direction of the LRBG

type.short-description: Distance in RV mode
type.description: Distance that can be run in RV mode

type.short-description: Distance from beginning of section to the Section Time-out stop location
Distance in SR mode
type.description: Distance that can be run in SR mode

type.short-description: Distance from overlap timer start location to End of Authority
Distance to start of reversing permitted area
Incremental distance to next discontinuity in a international SSP profile
Distance to change in route suitability
type.description: The incremental distance to where the route suitability data changes.

type.short-description: Distance from where on a track ahead free request shall be displayed
Distance from where on a text shall be displayed

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: The display of the text shall not be distance limited.

type.short-description: Track condition distance
type.description: The incremental distance to where the track conditions change.

type.short-description: Distance to start of empty profile
type.description: Distance to where initial states of the related track description in the packet shall be resumed

type.short-description: Distance to change of traction
Distance to beginning of temporary speed restriction
Distance to start of validity of national values
Safe gradient
type.description: This is the minimum gradient between two defined locations.

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: Non numerical value telling that the current gradient description ends at D_GRADIENT(n)

type.short-description: Default gradient for TSR supervision
type.description: defines a default gradient to be used for TSR supervision when no gradient profile (packet 21) is available.

type.short-description: Length of the acknowledgement area in rear of the required level
Length of the acknowledgement area in rear of the start of the required mode
Length of reduced adhesion
type.description: Length for which the reduced adhesion factor apply.

type.short-description: Length of speed restriction due to Axle load
Over-reading error
type.description: L_DOUBTOVER is the difference between the lower bound of the confidence interval and the estimated value of D_LRBG

type.short-description: Under-reading error
type.description: L_DOUBTUNDER is the difference between the upper bound of the confidence interval and the estimated value of D_LRBG

type.short-description: Length of the End section in the MA
Length of loop
type.description: The EOLM specifies the length of the loop starting from the distance indicated by D_LOOP

type.short-description: Length of the area of the required mode
Message length
type.description: L_MESSAGE indicates the length of the message in bytes, including all packets and all variables defined in the message header (NID_MESSAGE and L_MESSAGE also).

type.short-description: Packet length
type.description: L_PACKET indicates the length of the packet in bits, including all bits of the packet header

type.short-description: Length of the reversing permitted area
Length of section in the MA
Length on which a track ahead free request shall be displayed
Length of text string
type.description: L_TEXT defines the length of a text string (L_TEXT * X_TEXT)

type.short-description: Length on which a text shall be displayed
Length for which the defined track condition is valid
Train length
type.description: This is the absolute real length of the train.

type.short-description: Safe Train length
Length of the temporary speed restriction
Qualifier for acknowledgement request
type.description: Indicates whether the telegram must be acknowledged or not

type.short-description: Adhesion factor
airtight system presence
type.description: indicates whether the train is fitted with an airtight system or not.

type.short-description: Axle load
Duplicate balise
type.description: Flags to tell whether the balise is a duplicate of one of the adjacent balises.

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: This balise is a duplicate of the next balise (seen in the nominal direction of the balise group).
This balise is a duplicate of the previous balise (seen in the nominal direction of the balise group).

type.short-description: Identifier of the type of error

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: Fatal error (equipment in SL or NL mode)

type.short-description: Current Operating Level
Onboard operating level for text display
type.description: The text is displayed when entering / as long as in the defined level

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: The display of the text shall not be limited by the level

type.short-description: Required level
Load profile
type.description: Defining the loading gauge profile

type.short-description: Special location/moment where the train has to report its location

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: Now (The position report is sent upon receipt of the order)
Stop to send it at each balises.

type.short-description: Required mode for a part of the MA
Message counter
type.description: The purpose of this counter is to make it possible for the ERTMS/ETCS on-board to detect which balise group message the telegram belongs to.

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: The telegram never fits any message of the group
The telegram fits with all telegrams of the same balise group

type.short-description: Onboard operating mode
Onboard operating mode for text display
type.description: The text is displayed when entering / as long as in the defined mode

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: The display of the text shall not be limited by the mode.

type.short-description: Weighting factor for available wheel/rail adhesion
type.description: This variable is part of the National Values.

type.short-description: T_NVCONTACT reaction
type.description: Indicates the reaction to be performed when T_NVCONTACT timer elapses

type.short-description: Entry of Driver ID permitted while running
type.description: This variable is part of the National Values

type.short-description: Confidence level for emergency brake safe deceleration on dry rails
type.description: This variable is part of the National Values. Based on the required confidence level, the on-board equipment selects its corresponding rolling stock correction factor Kdry_rst(V). The confidence level on emergency brake safe deceleration represents the probability of the following individual event: the rolling stock emergency brake subsystem of the train does ensure a deceleration at least equal to A_brake_emergency(V) * Kdry_rst(V), when the emergency brake is commanded on dry rails.

type.short-description: Integrated correction factor Kr
type.description: This is the train length dependent integrated correction factor. M_NVKRINT(l) is valid for a train length between L_NVKRINT(l) and L_NVKRINT(l+1). M_NVKRINT is valid between 0m and L_NVKRINT(1) This variable is part of the National Values

type.short-description: Integrated correction factor Kt
type.description: This variable is part of the National Values.

type.short-description: Integrated correction factor Kv
type.description: This is the speed dependent integrated correction factor. M_NVKVINT(n) is valid for an estimated speed between V_NVKVINT(n) and V_NVKVINT(n+1). M_NVKVINT is valid between 0 km/h and V_NVKVINT(1) This variable is part of the National Values

type.short-description: Track kilometre reference value
type.description: The geographical position reporting function uses this variables content as a reference value.

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: No more geographical position reporting after this reference location

type.short-description: Type of track condition

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: Non stopping area ­ tunnel. Initial state: stopping permitted (no tunnel)
Non stopping area ­ bridge. Initial state: stopping permitted (no bridge)
Non stopping area ­ other reasons. Initial state: stopping permitted
Powerless section ­ lower pantograph. Initial state: not powerless section
Radio hole (stop supervising T_NVCONTACT). Initial state: supervise T_NVCONTACT
Air tightness. Initial state: no request for air tightness
Switch off regenerative brake. Initial state: regenerative brake on
Switch off eddy current brake for service brake. Initial state: eddy current brake for service brake on
Switch off magnetic shoe brake. Initial state: magnetic shoe brake on
Powerless section ­ switch off the main power switch. Initial state: not powerless section

type.short-description: Traction System Type
type.description: It defines the traction system to be used on a specific line (diesel/electric/kind of power pickup etc.) or respectively that can be used by a train

type.short-description: Version of the ETCS language
type.description: This gives the version of the ETCS language Each part indicates the first and second number of the version respectively. - The first number distinguishes not compatible versions. (The three MSB's) - The second number indicates compatibility within a version X. (The four LSB's)

type.short-description: International Train categories
type.description: It is the international class of train for which a differential value for the static line speed exists. Used together with V_DIFF to permit certain trains to go faster or lower than the "international basic static speed" given by V_STATIC. Value 0 of NC_DIFF corresponds to the LSB of NC_TRAIN, number 14 of NC_DIFF to MSB (15-bit variable) of NC_TRAIN.

type.short-description: International Category to which belongs the train.
type.description: Train category used for the static speed profile calculation. Thanks to NC_TRAIN, the train knows the SSP it must obey. by receiving a list of static speed profile, thanks to NC_TRAIN, the train can select the SSP it must obey. Each bit represents one category. A train can belong to various categories.

type.short-description: Identity number of the balise group
type.description: Identity number of a balise group or loop within the country or region defined by NID_C.

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: only accept balise groups containing repositioning information for the running direction (only to be used in linking)

type.short-description: Identity number of the country or region
type.description: Code used to identify the country or region in which the balise group is situated. These need not necessarily follow administrative or political boundaries.

type.short-description: Emergency message identity
type.description: Identifies the number of the emergency message

type.short-description: Onboard ETCS identity
type.description: The ETCS identity number is uniquely defined for ERTMS/ETCS purposes

type.short-description: Identity number of the loop
type.description: Identity number of a loop within the country or region defined by NID_C given in the EOLM balise header.

type.short-description: Identity of last relevant balise group
type.description: Country/region identity (NID_C) + balise identity number of last relevant balise group (NID_BG).

type.short-description: Identity of the level 2/3 transition balise group
type.description: Identity of the balise group at the level 2/3 transition location towards which the train is running. Country/region identity (NID_C) + balise identity number of the level 2/3 transition location balise group (NID_BG).

type.short-description: Message identifier
type.description: Message identifier

type.short-description: Identity of Radio Network
type.description: The NID_MN identifies the GSM-R network the calling mobile station has to register with. The NID_MN consists of up to 6 digits which are entered left adjusted into the data field, the leftmost digit is the digit to be dialled first. In case the NID_MN is shorter than 6 digits, the remaining space is to be filled with special character "F". For further information about NID_MN refer to Subset-54.

type.short-description: Train Running Number
type.description: This is the operational train running number.

type.short-description: Packet identifier
type.description: This is used in the header for each packet, allowing the receiving equipment to identify the data which follows.

type.short-description: Identity of the previous balise group
type.description: Previous balise group detected when running towards the balise group identified as LRBG with no change of direction in-between. Country/region identity (NID_C) + balise identity number of the previous balise group (NID_BG).

type.short-description: Radio subscriber number.
type.description: Quoted as a 16 digit decimal number. The number is to be entered "left adjusted" starting with the first digit to be dialled. Padding by the special value F shall be added after the least significant digit of the number. For further information about NID_RADIO refer to SUBSET-054.

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: Use the short number stored onboard

type.short-description: RBC ETCS identity number
type.description: This variable provides the identity of the RBC belonging to NID_C. The RBC ETCS identity is given by NID_C + NID_RBC.

type.short-description: Identity of radio in-fill unit
type.description: This variable provides the identity of the RIU belonging to NID_C. The RIU ETCS identity is given by NID_C + NID_RIU.

type.short-description: STM identity
type.description: One value of this variable represents the identity of an STM reflecting each composition of national infrastructure.

type.short-description: Identity number of Temporary Speed Restriction.

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: Reserved for non RBC transmission (balise, loop or radio infill)
Non-revocable speed restriction (applicable for all transmission media)

type.short-description: Identity of user system
type.description: Identity of user system for which remainder of packet is intended.

type.short-description: Number of iterations of a data set following this variable in a packet
type.description: If N_ITER is 0 then no data set is following. Two nested levels of iterations can exist.

type.short-description: Position in Group
type.description: Defines the relative position in a balise group

type.short-description: Total number of balise(s) in the group
Aspect of "danger for shunting" signal
Qualifier for danger point description.
type.description: This variable is set to 1 if either a danger point exists or a release speed has to be specified

type.short-description: Validity direction of transmitted data
type.description: Qualifier to indicate the relevant validity direction of transmitted data, with reference to directionality of the balise group sending the information or to directionality of the LRBG, in case of information sent via radio.

type.short-description: Orientation of the train in relation to the direction of the LRBG
Direction of train movement in relation to the LRBG orientation
Qualifier telling on which side of the LRBG the estimated front end is
Qualifier for emergency stop acknowledgement
type.description: Qualifier to indicate whether the train has ignored or not a conditional emergency stop. For an unconditional emergency stop, it is set to "not relevant"

type.short-description: Qualifier to indicate whether end section timer information exists for the End section in the MA

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: End section timer information to follow

type.short-description: Qualifier for validity end point of profile element
type.description: Qualifier to indicate if a speed limit given for a profile element is to be applied until the front of the train (no train length delay) or the end of the train (train length delay) has left the element.

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: Train length delay on validity end point of profile element.
No train length delay on validity end point of profile element

type.short-description: Qualifier for gradient slope.
Qualifier to indicate whether a train is entering or exiting the radio infill area.
Qualifier for train integrity status
type.description: Qualifier, identifying the train integrity information available. The related safe train length information is given by L_TRAININT

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: Train integrity confirmed by integrity monitoring device

type.short-description: Qualifier for the specified report location
type.description: This qualifier tells whether the train has to report its location when the max safe front end or when the min safe rear end has over passed the location defined by D_LOC

type.short-description: Link Qualifier
type.description: This qualifier is used to mark a balise group as linked or unlinked.

type.short-description: Qualifier for the direction of the linked balise group
type.description: Indicates whether the linked balise group will be overpassed by the train in nominal or reverse direction.

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: The balise group is seen by the train in reverse direction
The balise group is seen by the train in nominal direction

type.short-description: linking reaction
type.description: Qualifier for the reaction to be performed if a linking or a balise group message consistency problem occurs with the balise group linked to.

type.short-description: Accuracy of the balise location
type.description: This Qualifier defines the absolute value of the accuracy of the Balise location (i.e., the value 63m identifies a location accuracy of +/- 63m)

type.short-description: Qualifier to indicate the direction of the loop
type.description: Indicates LOOP-reference direction in relation to EOLM direction

type.short-description: Qualifier to indicate the type of media
type.description: Indicates whether it is a balise telegram or a loop message

type.short-description: Qualifier for track kilometre direction.
type.description: Qualifier to indicate the direction of counting of the geographical position track kilometre in relation to the geographical position reference balise group directionality.

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: Opposite (counting downwards if passed in nominal direction or counting upwards if passed in reverse direction)
Same (counting upwards if passed in nominal direction or counting downwards if passed in reverse direction)

type.short-description: New Country Qualifier
type.description: Qualifier to indicate whether the next balise group is in the same country / railway administration as the one before inside the packet or not. For the first balise group in the packet, if Q_NEWCOUNTRY = 0, it is the same country / railway administration as the one of the LRBG within the radio message or the one of balise group within the balise telegram giving the packet.

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: Same country / railway administration, no NID_C follows
Not the same country / railway administration, NID_C follows

type.short-description: Qualifier for the modification of trackside adhesion factor by driver
type.description: This variable is part of the National Values

type.short-description: Qualifier Emergency Brake Release
type.description: Permission to release the emergency brake immediately if the condition why the system has triggered the emergency brake (speed exceeds emergency brake intervention limit, lack of driver reaction) is not fulfilled any more. Note: The action to release the brakes (e.g., by pressing a button) is a different issue and depends on the braking system This variable is part of the National Values

type.short-description: Default accuracy of the balise location (absolute value)
type.description: This variable is part of the National Values

type.short-description: Permission to use service brake when braking to a target is supervised
type.description: This variable is part of the National Values

type.short-description: Co-ordinate system assigned to a single balise group
type.description: The co-ordinate system is assigned by the RBC to a balise group reported by the on-board equipment as LRBG. The information reverse/nominal (i.e., the assigned co-ordinate system) is given in relation to the direction in which the balise has been passed when reading it.

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: The balise group has been passed by the train in reverse direction
The balise group has been passed by the train in nominal direction

type.short-description: Qualifier to tell whether there is an overlap
type.description: This variable is set to 1 if either an overlap exists or a release speed has to be specified

type.short-description: Qualifier for communication session order
Qualifier for communication session order
Qualifier for the distance scale.
type.description: Qualifier to indicate the same scale used for describing all distances inside the packet that contains Q_SCALE.

type.short-description: Qualifier to indicate whether there is a Section Time Out related to the section
Session management for sleeping equipment
type.description: Order for a Sleeping onboard equipment to consider or not the "session management" information

type.short-description: "Stop if in Staff Responsible" information
type.description: Specifies whether an onboard equipment in staff responsible has to stop or not

type.short-description: Spread Spectrum Code for Euroloop
type.description: Specifies the code required to receive telegrams from a specific Euroloop installation.

type.short-description: status of SoM position report
type.description: It provides the status of the position report

type.short-description: Type of route suitability data
Fixed message to be displayed.
type.description: Q_TEXT is a pointer to select a fixed text message from the defined table. The language selected by the driver for the MMI shall be used additionally as a qualifier to choose the appropriate language table.

type.short-description: Class of message to be displayed.
type.description: Q_TEXTCLASS specifies the class of the text message included in the same packet (either plain or fixed message)

type.short-description: Qualifies the need / reaction of text confirmation

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: Apply service brake if not confirmed when end conditions reached

type.short-description: Qualifier for the combination of text message conditions
type.description: Q_TEXTDISPLAY defines whether the start/end conditions for text message are to be combined or not

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: No, display as soon as / until one of the conditions is fulfilled
Yes, display as soon as / until all conditions are fulfilled

type.short-description: Track description deleted.
type.description: Qualifier to indicate whether the onboard has deleted (for any reason) track description or not.

type.short-description: Qualifier for resuming the initial states of the related track description of the packet.

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: No initial states to be resumed, profile to follow
Empty profile, initial states to be resumed

type.short-description: Balise telegram transmission direction
type.description: It defines the direction of the information in the balise telegram

type.short-description: Time Interval between two location reports sent by the train
type.description: The train must send its location every T_CYCLOC

type.short-description: Time between two cyclic requests for a movement authority
type.description: When the train asks for a movement authority request, it will repeat its request every T_CYCRQST seconds until it receives a new MA

type.short-description: Validity time for the End section in the MA
type.description: Time for which the End section is valid measured from the moment the train reaches the location defined by D_ENDTIMERSTARTLOC.

type.short-description: Validity time for the target speedat the LOA
type.description: Time for which the target speed is valid measured from the moment information is received

type.short-description: Time before reaching indication limit for the EOA/LOA
Maximal time without new "safe" message.
type.description: If no "safe" message has been received from the track for more than T_NVCONTACT seconds, an appropriate action according to M_NVCONTACT must be triggered. This variable is part of the National Values

type.short-description: Maximum time for overriding the train trip
type.description: This variable is part of the National Values

type.short-description: Overlap validity time
type.description: The time span the train can expect the overlap to be available, measured from the moment the train reaches the location defined by D_STARTOL.

type.short-description: Validity time of a section in the MA
type.description: Time for which the section is valid.

type.short-description: Time until when a text shall be displayed

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: Display of text not limited by time.

type.short-description: Time before any section timer expires
Trainborne clock
type.description: Time, according to trainborne clock, at which message is sent

type.short-description: Speed restriction related to axleload
Absolute Positive Speed associated to a train category.
Permitted speed at the limit of authority
Signalling related speed restriction
Required mode related speed

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: Use the national speed value of the required mode

type.short-description: Maximum permitted train speed.
type.description: Maximum permitted speed for the train, taking into account the maximum speed of every vehicle contained in the train set.

type.short-description: Maximum speed limit allowing the driver to select the "override EOA" function
type.description: This variable is part of the National Values

type.short-description: On Sight mode (permitted) speed limit
type.description: This variable is part of the National Values

type.short-description: Release Speed (permitted) speed limit
type.description: This variable is part of the National Values

type.short-description: Shunting mode (permitted) speed limit
type.description: This variable is part of the National Values

type.short-description: Staff Responsible mode (permitted) speed limit
type.description: This variable is part of the National Values

type.short-description: Permitted speed limit to be supervised when the "override EOA" function is active
type.description: This variable is part of the National Values

type.short-description: Unfitted mode (permitted) speed limit
type.description: This variable is part of the National Values

type.short-description: Release speed associated with the danger point
Release speed associated with the overlap
Maximum speed in RV mode
Static speed profile
type.description: Static speed profile speed after discontinuity (k).

special-or-reserved-value.meaning: Non numerical value telling that the static speed profile description ends at D_STATIC(n)

type.short-description: Actual Train speed
Permitted speed for the temporary speed restriction
Text String Element
type.description: Text strings are used to transmit plain text messages. Each element of a text string contains a single character encoded as ISO 8859-1, also known as Latin Alphabet #1.

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/NATIONAL_VALUES
field-group.description: Downloads a set of National Values to the train

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/LINKING
field-group.description: Linking Information.

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/LEVEL_1_MOVEMENT_AUTHORITY
field-group.description: Transmission of a movement authority for level 1.

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/LEVEL_2_3_MOVEMENT_AUTHORITY
field-group.description: Transmission of a movement authority for levels 2/3.

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/REPOSITIONING_INFORMATION
field-group.description: Transmission of the update of the current distance

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/GRADIENT_PROFILE
field-group.description: Transmission of the gradient. D_GRADIENT gives the distance to the next change of the gradient value. The gradient value is the minimum gradient for the given distance.

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/INTERNATIONAL_STATIC_SPEED_PROFILE
field-group.description: Static speed profile and optionally speed limits depending on the international train category.

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/TRACK_CONDITION_CHANGE_OF_TRACTION_POWER
field-group.description: The packet gives information about change of the traction power system.

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/LEVEL_TRANSITION_ORDER
field-group.description: Packet to identify where a level transition shall take place. In case of mixed levels, the successive M_LEVELTR's go from the highest priority level to the lowest one.

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/SESSION_MANAGEMENT
field-group.description: Packet to give the identity and telephone number of the RBC with which a session shall be established or terminated.

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/RADIO_NETWORK_REGISTRATION
field-group.description: Packet to give the identity of the Radio Network to which a registration shall be enforced.

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/CONDITIONAL_LEVEL_TRANSITION_ORDER
field-group.description: Packet for a conditional level transition. The successive M_LEVELTR's go from the highest priority level to the lowest one.

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/LIST_OF_BALISES_FOR_SH_AREA
field-group.description: Used to list balise group(s) which the train can pass over in SH mode

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/AXLE_LOAD_SPEED_PROFILE
field-group.description: This packet gives the speed restrictions for trains with axle load higher than or equal to the specified value for the speed restriction

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/MOVEMENT_AUTHORITY_REQUEST_PARAMETERS
field-group.description: This packet is intended to give parameters telling when and how often the train has to ask for a movement authority.

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/POSITION_REPORT_PARAMETERS
field-group.description: This packet is intended to give parameters telling when and how often the position has to be reported.

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/LIST_OF_BALISES_IN_SR_AUTHORITY
field-group.description: Used to list balise group(s) which the train can pass over in SR mode

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/TEMPORARY_SPEED_RESTRICTION
field-group.description: Transmission of temporary speed restriction.

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/TEMPORARY_SPEED_RESTRICTION_REVOCATION
field-group.description: Transmission of temporary speed restriction revocation.

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/TRACK_CONDITION_BIG_METAL_MASSES
field-group.description: The packet gives details concerning where to ignore integrity check alarms of balise transmission due to big metal masses trackside.

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/TRACK_CONDITION
field-group.description: The packet gives details concerning the track ahead to support the driver when e.g. lower pantograph

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/ROUTE_SUITABILITY_DATA
field-group.description: The packet gives the characteristics needed to enter a route.

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/ADHESION_FACTOR
field-group.description: This packet is used when the trackside requests a change of the adhesion factor to be used in the brake model.

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/GEOGRAPHICAL_POSITION_INFORMATION
field-group.description: This packet gives geographical location information for one or multiple references to the train.

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/MODE_PROFILE
field-group.description: Mode profile associated to an MA

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/TRACK_AHEAD_FREE_UP_TO_LEVEL_2_3_TRANSITION_LOCATION
field-group.description: Notification to on-board that track ahead is free from the balise group transmitting this information up to the level 2/3 transition location

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/RBC_TRANSITION_ORDER
field-group.description: Packet to order an RBC transition

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/DANGER_FOR_SHUNTING_INFORMATION
field-group.description: Transmission of the aspect of a shunting signal

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/EOLM_PACKET
field-group.description: This packet announces a loop.

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/INFILL_LOCATION_REFERENCE
field-group.description: Defines location reference for all data contained in the same radio message or balise/loop telegram respectively, following this packet.

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/STOP_IF_IN_STAFF_RESPONSIBLE
field-group.description: Information to stop a train in staff responsible.

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/REVERSING_AREA_INFORMATION
field-group.description: Used to send start and length of reversing area to the on-board

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/REVERSING_SUPERVISION_INFORMATION
field-group.description: Used to send supervision parameters (distance to run, speed) of reversing area to the on-board

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/TRAIN_RUNNING_NUMBER_FROM_RBC
field-group.description: Train running number from RBC

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/DEFAULT_GRADIENT_FOR_TEMPORARY_SPEED_RESTRICTION
field-group.description: It defines a default gradient to be used for TSR supervision when no gradient profile (packet 21) is available

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/SESSION_MANAGEMENT_WITH_NEIGHBOURING_RADIO_IN_FILL_UNIT
field-group.description: Session Management with neighbouring Radio In-fill Unit

field-group.name: PACKET/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/DEFAULT_BALISE_LOOP_OR_RIU_INFORMATION
field-group.description: Indication to on-board that balise telegram, loop message or RIU information contains default information due to a fault of the trackside equipment.

field-group.name: PACKET/TRAIN_TO_TRACK/POSITION_REPORT
field-group.description: This packet is inserted in all train-to-track telegrams and is used to report the train position and speed as well as some additional information (e.g. mode, level, etc.)

field-group.name: PACKET/TRAIN_TO_TRACK/POSITION_REPORT_BASED_ON_TWO_BALISE_GROUPS
field-group.description: This packet is an extension of the "standard position report " packet 0. It is used in case of single balise groups if the orientation of the LRBG is unknown but the on-board equipment is able to report a second balise group (the one detected before) to give an indication of the running direction to the RBC.

field-group.name: PACKET/TRAIN_TO_TRACK/ONBOARD_TELEPHONE_NUMBERS
field-group.description: Telephone numbers associated to the onboard equipment

field-group.name: PACKET/TRAIN_TO_TRACK/ERROR_REPORTING
field-group.description: Error reporting to the RBC

field-group.name: PACKET/TRAIN_TO_TRACK/LEVEL_2_3_TRANSITION_INFORMATION
field-group.description: Identity of the level 2/3 transition balise group

field-group.name: PACKET/TRAIN_TO_TRACK/VALIDATED_TRAIN_DATA
field-group.description: Validated train data. For some variables, if the engine does not know a data value, it may use the corresponding default value

field-group.name: PACKET/ANY/END_OF_INFORMATION
field-group.description: This packet consists only of NID_PACKET containing 8 bit 1s It acts as a finish flag ; the receiver will stop reading the remaining part of the message/telegram when receiving eight bits set to one in the NID_PACKET field.

field-group.name: PACKET/DATA_USED_BY_APPLICATIONS_OUTSIDE_THE_ERTMS_ETCS_SYSTEM
field-group.description: Messages between trackside and on-board devices, which contain information used by applications outside the ERTMS/ETCS system.

field-group.name: EUROBALISE
field-group.description: Eurobalise

field-group.name: EUROLOOP
field-group.description: Euroloop

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRAIN_TO_TRACK/VALIDATED_TRAIN_DATA
field-group.description: Validated Train Data

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRAIN_TO_TRACK/REQUEST_FOR_SHUNTING
field-group.description: Request for Shunting

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRAIN_TO_TRACK/MA_REQUEST
field-group.description: MA Request

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRAIN_TO_TRACK/TRAIN_POSITION_REPORT
field-group.description: Train Position Report

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRAIN_TO_TRACK/REQUEST_TO_SHORTEN_MA_IS_GRANTED
field-group.description: Request to shorten MA is granted

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRAIN_TO_TRACK/REQUEST_TO_SHORTEN_MA_IS_REJECTED
field-group.description: Request to shorten MA is rejected

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRAIN_TO_TRACK/ACKNOWLEDGEMENT
field-group.description: Acknowledgement

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRAIN_TO_TRACK/ACKNOWLEDGEMENT_OF_EMERGENCY_STOP
field-group.description: Acknowledgement of Emergency Stop

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRAIN_TO_TRACK/TRACK_AHEAD_FREE_GRANTED
field-group.description: Track Ahead Free Granted

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRAIN_TO_TRACK/END_OF_MISSION
field-group.description: End of Mission

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRAIN_TO_TRACK/RADIO_INFILL_REQUEST
field-group.description: Radio in-fill request

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRAIN_TO_TRACK/NO_COMPATIBLE_VERSION
field-group.description: No compatible version

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRAIN_TO_TRACK/INITIATION_OF_A_COMMUNICATION_SESSION
field-group.description: Initiation of a communication session

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRAIN_TO_TRACK/TERMINATION_OF_A_COMMUNICATION_SESSION
field-group.description: Termination of a communication session

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRAIN_TO_TRACK/SOM_POSITION_REPORT
field-group.description: SoM Position Report

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRAIN_TO_TRACK/SESSION_ESTABLISHED
field-group.description: Session Established

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/SR_AUTHORISATION
field-group.description: SR Authorisation

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/MOVEMENT_AUTHORITY
field-group.description: Movement Authority

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/RECOGNITION_OF_EXIT_FROM_TRIP_MODE
field-group.description: Recognition of exit from TRIP mode

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/ACKNOWLEDGEMENT_OF_TRAIN_DATA
field-group.description: Acknowledgement of Train Data

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/REQUEST_TO_SHORTEN_MA
field-group.description: Request to Shorten MA

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/CONDITIONAL_EMERGENCY_STOP
field-group.description: Conditional Emergency Stop

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/UNCONDITIONAL_EMERGENCY_STOP
field-group.description: Unconditional Emergency Stop

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/REVOCATION_OF_EMERGENCY_STOP
field-group.description: Revocation of Emergency Stop

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/GENERAL_MESSAGE
field-group.description: General message

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/SH_REFUSED
field-group.description: SH Refused

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/SH_AUTHORISED
field-group.description: SH Authorised

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/MA_WITH_SHIFTED_LOCATION_REFERENCE
field-group.description: MA with Shifted Location Reference

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/TRACK_AHEAD_FREE_REQUEST
field-group.description: Track Ahead Free Request

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/INFILL_MA
field-group.description: In-fill MA

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/TRAIN_REJECTED
field-group.description: Train Rejected

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/CONFIGURATION_DETERMINATION
field-group.description: Configuration Determination

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/INITIATION_OF_A_COMMUNICATION_SESSION
field-group.description: Initiation of a communication session

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/ACKNOWLEDGEMENT_OF_TERMINATION_OF_A_COMMUNICATION_SESSION
field-group.description: Acknowledgement of termination of a communication session

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/TRAIN_ACCEPTED
field-group.description: Train Accepted

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/SOM_POSITION_REPORT_CONFIRMED_BY_RBC
field-group.description: SoM position report confirmed by RBC

field-group.name: MESSAGE/TRACK_TO_TRAIN/ASSIGNMENT_OF_COORDINATE_SYSTEM
field-group.description: Assignment of coordinate system
